moves.7... Nc6 8. d5: White presses forth, and will follow with e4
moves.8... Nb8 9. e4 a6: I think this is an error on my part, should have put the Knight to d7
Time to have a go at c4 and try to encourage b3
moves.14... Ne5 15. Qb3: This is a poor move, it allows the knight to d3 and gives black the opportunity of removing the black squared bishop
moves.15... Nd3 16. Re3 Nxc1 17. Rxc1: Black now has the bishop pair, and will force white to open the king side with b-h6
moves.19... Bd4 20. Kf1: This black bishop is a good piece but white's rooks are strong so it is best to get rid
moves.23. dxe6 Bxe6 24. Nd5 b6 25. Qc3: White is looking for N-f6 to cause all type of trouble
moves.25... Bxd5 26. cxd5: Black places the queen on a better square
moves.26... Qd7 27. Qf6 Rfe8: Again trying to simplify, the d pawn will fall
moves.28. Rd3: White gives up the file, Black grabs a pawn and is threatening all kinds of nastiness
moves.28... Qxa4: White has to stop Qa1+, if white plays Bf3, is met by qc2, and black wins another pawn
moves.29. d6: White has missed it mate in three
